alert.note: Alert for Huntingdon; Juniata (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 10:21PM EST until January 10 at 9:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Centre, Huntingdon, Juniata and Mifflin. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 PM EST, rain and snowmelt continues, and will cause minor flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Less than one quarter of an inch of additional rain is expected tonight. - The additional rain and the continued run off from earlier rains will result in minor flooding. The water will start to recede tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... State College, Lewistown, Huntingdon, Bellefonte, Lamar, Mount Union, Stormstown, Lemont, Burnham, Zion, Spring Mills, Port Royal, Belleville, Houserville, Warriors Mark, Pine Grove Mills and Milroy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
